function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i<N' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i<N' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i<6' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i<6' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<N' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<6' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'a (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'b (line 5)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'i' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'b' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
